Tabs

Organize all the content within your page

Note: You need castlecss-tabs or the castlecss-boilerplate for this.

Feel free to use these tabs to get you started. Create your own tabs.scss to overwrite the standard tabs.

Example

  • Tab title 1
  • Tab title 2
  • Tab title 3

Tab 1

This is the first tab

Tab 2

This is the second tab

Tab 3

This is the third tab

How it works

Every tab-header is connected to a tab-panel. To open the correct tab-panel when the user clicks on a tab-header, we use two attributes: Each tab has an attribute data-castlecss-tab-header with a value. The value of this attibute should match the value of the attribute data-castlecss-tab-panel on the tab-panel.

Options

Full width tabs

tabs are default shown inline. With CastleCSS Tabs it is also possible to make the tabs 100% width. To do so change the tabs-header to tabs-header tabs-header-full

Example full width tabs

  • Tab title 1
  • Tab title 2
  • Tab title 3

Mobile accordions

It is possible to show the tabs as accordions on screens to 1024px wide. To do so change the tabs to tabs tabs-accordion

Example accordions

To view the accordion make your screen less wide

  • Tab title 2
